p: The global prevalence of HCV infection is estimated at 2–3%.[ 27 28 29 30] The prevalence of HCV is highest in Africa and the Middle East. China, India, Egypt, Pakistan, and Indonesia account for approximately half of the global HCV-infected subjects.[ 31 32 33 34] North America, Australia, Japan, and Northern and Western Europe report lower prevalence of HCV infection, with no country showing a rate > 2%. Owing to the paucity of large-scale prevalence studies on hepatitis C in the general population of India, the reported prevalence rates are variable ranging from 0.09–2.02%.[ 35]
